IXe0txjAYGVuCSs4Epe6EA.text: Stumbled into this joint a few weeks back after it being recommended by the previous bar we were in.  It's located between two sex shops and not signed at all, just go down the stairs and turn left.Cocktails looked great (I only tasted a bit of one and seemed mighty fine) and vibe was a real hoot.  Closes at 3am and table service, which actually worked very well.  Would definitely come back for late night drinks.I read afterwards that the barman is some famous mixologist and has been on the London cocktail scene for 20+ years.  Will definitely try more of the cocktail menu next time...

Jedr9yGvya7Nhtnys5zAaQ.text: I hit El Camino on a stroll through Soho a few weeks back.  A friend of mine has always had high praise for the Portobello Road location, but warned about the relatively high prices at the Brewer Street one.  I found the service quick and friendly.  However - and perhaps it's ingrained in me from living in the US for most of my life and the mountains of food usually served up at the mexican places there -  I was mildly disappointed by the three tiny little fish tacos I got!  Tasty and fresh indeed, but still for the price (roughly £8, if remember correctly)....not much there.   My total bill for 2 beers, tacos and some chips and salsa to start was about £14.  A little steep I must say.  a nice place to stop in but I would recommend that anyone searching for some tasty Mexican in London would be much better served by hitting Taqueria in Westbourne Grove.  yum!

ckhlwg894wu4abqvg0h7RA.text: I'm a huge, huge fan of El Camion - and agree with all the other reviews here that say you're guaranteed a good night. Basically, if I want to be sure of having tasty (and authentic) food, delicious cocktails, and a banging good time, then I'll come here. The DJs play awesome sets, and they also have a hilarious band on Wednesday nights that gets the whole underground bar on their feet and dancing. I've not found anywhere else like it in London - and Soho really is the ideal place for it. They serve the best margaritas you're likely to find - seriously, seriously good - and the food has never disappointed. I come back time and again for their beef burritos with a side of cheese stuffed deep fried peppers, or you can share a long tray of tacos and a jug of cocktail which is INCREDIBLE. Also, it's fun to scan the wall of hot sauce and dare each other to try the most interesting ones - and they have loads! Most importantly for me though is the tequila selection. I am a huge fan of tequila and mezcal and El Camion have some of the best around. Plus, you can tell the staff have been really educated and actually care about the spirits they sell, because I've spent more than one night propping up the bar and chatting all things agave with them! Love it, recommend a visit.

eebuUu_VqA6aZmBAUWxjHg.text: Mmm. Burrito hey? Looking at this place from the outside I first thought: strip joint? I guess it's suffering from the location, but still, they picked the slightly dodgy facade. When I got in there I was pleasantly surprised - quite clean and friendly! (Strip joints are so unclean and unfriendly these days.) There was plenty of seating, pretty decent service, and as Andrew points out, a vast array of amusing hot sauces on the wall. I didn't partake in the Qype staff face off but the 100% pain looked fairly viscious! As for the burrito - this is what only warrants 3 stars. Seemed fairly ordinary to me. None of the wonderful flavour and spice you get in some places. All a little neat and tidy too. A burrito is a dirty feed - there should be sauce splashing all over the plate. And ... £7 odd. Bit pricey for a lunchtime burrito. If I want burrito I'll be going elsewhere, although I'm sure this place will do well being on the south side of Soho, el touristo trappo.

22q-9CTGURGSwsyV9i0Yww.text: El Camino is a new addition to the growing tex-mex scene in London. I have to say, it is distinctly average. It's mainly let down by it's sloppy service - and some of the dishes are so-so. I always get grumpy with paying more than a couple of quid for a tiny pot of guacamole, and El Camino are guilty of this crime. It's so cheap to make - why are you fleecing people for it? The tortilla chips and salsa are also a bit pricey, for what is probably the easiest starter in the world to serve up. Cocktails - we only tried the classic Margarita - but it was well mixed and they certainly did not skimp on the tequila. However, it got served up in the dullest tall glass - where's my Margarita glass with the salted rim? No show-manship on that front.... The corn tacos come in a minuscule sized portion - my friend had to order some more food just to get close to feeling full! The Burritos however are a different story - very tasty fillings, and the portion sizes are just right. I thought the mix of ingredients was well balanced too - and I've eaten my way round a lot of Burritos in London.... What we really did enjoy was the relaxed atmosphere, the kitsch tablecloths and the excellent display of spicy sauces from around the world! What we liked the least was the over-priciness of some items and the slightly lazy service. El Camino will not blow you away from a culinary point of view , but it is a lot of fun. It's definitley a place for friends, cocktails and good times.

sHjZVe77jUHrYv28Cwkzxg.text: If I could I d give no stars. Bad slow service, took ages to gives a table and there were only two people eating in the whole restaurant at the time. The menu is confusing and the waiter did not help at all. Then they put very loud music, I was with a friend I had not seen for 15 years! When I asked, the waiter mock me by saying that they would put the music even louder. I ve got so angry I left before ordering. Waste of time, I was starving and I had to look for another place. I am glad I did, the place looked depressing and I am sure the food would have been too. Do not go if you want a good environment and Mex food go to el Chiquito Leicester Square. Good food and excellent service!

Sxl9ZQ-Hi2t-ed2vBff2nQ.text: First let me note that I am from Southern California, but that I've lived in London for more than five years so my scoring is based on more realistic expectations (the bar has been officially lowered). We were initially put off by underwhelming and downright not good salsa and guacamole (my Irish husband was the first to comment so not just me!). But we were pleasantly surprised by the mains which were pretty tasty. My enchiladas could have used a dollop of sour cream with them, but I'm sure I could have ordered it as an extra if I really wanted to. The one thing that was a bit odd was that we wanted a pitcher of margarita which they were fine to do as frozen, but not on the rocks.  I get that the frozen stuff is ready made and out of a machine, but how hard is it to mix together a pitcher of margarita. But overall, not a bad spot for Mexican food, just don't go in expecting to be wowed and you might want to just go straight for the mains.

PfvndWffjwmaWE0saF1QLA.text: I actually like this place.  It could be better portion wise and they really should serve frozen/blended margaritas, but other than that, I eat here regularly and its pretty sweet.

bNcUn_-tydYo-REitQEYYg.text: Pretty decent Mexican - at least the tortilla chips are fresh (and are NOT Doritos - why do places here even consider using Doritos in their nachos?!) Serving of guacamole was measly but pork nachos were generous and tasty. The pork burrito is ok - there are better places in London to get burritos - but it was a nice place to go with friends and chat for an evening, so the atmosphere makes up for a bit. Service was friendly, if slow - don't go here if you're looking for something quick.

ZBdp_NVqLIavG7spFZuXzw.text: I've had a hard time finding good, authentic Tex-Mex food in London...until now. Excellent choices, attentive staff, amazing beer selection. There's a bar downstairs and a restaurant at street level. Go and treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom

MXpIN0w_M5R-p5SDGzy5Lg.text: Quirky Cal-Mex style restaurant and bar.  I'm a fan of the downstairs bar.

uT5cEvF3Ii3UJnW0fsQhKw.text: I went to their downstairs bar a few nights ago and, whilst I wasn't blown away, it is a fairly pleasant place for a late night drink. The bar was serving a good range of mexican beers and cockails, as well offering a fairly wide menu for anyone after a late night snack. The bar staff were friendly but the atmosphere was slightly subdued, something which wasn't helped by the slightly-too-loud level of music being played by a bored-looking DJ. On a busy night the bar might have a great vibe, otherwise it's a decent enough option if you're in the area after hours.

Q0sXI6b6MLWLNowTeL6NpA.text: Lunch special advertised at £7.50. Food good, but portions small. The burrito was smaller than the full-price version so you get what you pay for. Got a surprise at the till when the bill was £8.44 due to hidden service charge of £0.94, or 12.5%. Yes the service was awesome but in London my tip should be discretionary, and if you advertise a special the diner should pay only that. Buyer beware, I won't be coming back here.

2Q9-Rw21uXzT_Am05Xwr3w.text: Thank to the guidance of an intriguing stranger online, we went in seek for some of London's best nachos and we found some pretty amazing ones here. We got the black bean and jalapeño nachos and realized we needed two orders! Also had the mushroom and spinach quesadilla which was really good as well. Went here at around 4PM on a Monday and it was quiet and relaxing. Definitely recommend.

UugYj5A5pYG1iYz0QruI0g.text: Tequila  it makes you happy!If you like Tequila then this is your place!Tequila cocktail, an extensive list of Tequila's and a burrito restaurant upstairs means you can eat with your drinks.I loved the day of the dead Mexican decor with stag heads, fairy lights and intimate booths.

GwsV4U61JSXY_pQyfUHARQ.text: Stopped here very late Saturday night, well actually Sunday morning with my GF, just looking for drinks. On that basis I can't vouch for the food but I can say the Margaritas were good. All the staff including the doorman, were very friendly, which helps to create a chilled atmosphere. Will be back to try the food.

PVWUFEjZ-ulMv1O8V13GLQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a bite before a matinee and walked by El Camion and decided Mexican sounded awesome! After walking in we stood at the front behind a few guys waiting for take out I assume? A waitress in the back waved us in to sit anywhere. I was so excited because they had one of my favorite hot sauces at the table, Valentina.There was a small menu at the table I was looking through, my boyfriend grabbed one from the table next to us. There were two other people in the restaurant, it was not busy. The waitress came by, dropped off two large menus, and ripped the smaller menu out of my boyfriend's hands and slammed it loudly back on the table next to us and walked off. Me: uhhh, that was weirdHim: what just happened?Me: that was weird right?Him: yeah, it was really rude actuallyMe: ok, want to leaveHim: yesNo clue what we did to trigger her actions, we were in a great mood and excited for this place. There are too many options in London to put up with service like this. We just wanted a burrito. We ended up at Ceviche (review of that posted).

kXq6OrtDI-l-OcQfrsN7SA.text: Better than your usual mexican places and prefer to la bodega. The tacos need some sauce! Get the grilled fish

JRXmFBZty15KTstMDhUD5A.text: It had been a rough month. I love my mom as much as the next girl, but a month of her is a long time. So on the day she headed home, leaving me to fend for myself in London for a few days, I did what any sensible Californian girl would do, I found Mexican and started drinking. Now the drink part is irrelevant to this review, but the Mexican is not.It is good. I mean really good. I mean so good I am actually passing on the info of El Camion Mexicano to any number of friends of mine who might find themselves in the SoHo area. I got the chicken burrito, my staple at any Mexican place I go. It was big enough to leave me totally satisfied, but not so big I felt as if I would burst. Plus, I think they put mole in the meat. MOLE!!! It was the AWESOMEST!!!! Seriously. So one burrito and two Sol beers later I was ready to go celebrate Oscar Wilde's birthday with a vengeance. Oh yeah, and felt much more relaxed.

9U7YsCpicDjXNNlvme239Q.text: This was hard to choose between three and four stars, because me and my friends had so much fun in the downstairs' bar!- the cocktails were delicious! Nothing too sweet, really refreshing! one big YUM!- music was so funnily random to my taste - it was great to dance to and to forget all the troublesome reality.- it was hot and sweaty! Once in a long time, I enjoyed that too! It matched the atmosphere and tipsy, dance-some night.- bar was small. This was my biggest issue. The venue could be bigger, because it was really crowded. Although the bar staff was superbly fast, they struggled with all the customers.. 10 mins waiting for a drink - no problem!My question is - will I remember I went there in two weeks? Probably not... The place simply doesn't stand out..

U4JegCf-SMcAdPbZTPEqLg.text: Good pork nachos...not as authentic as I would have expected from prior reviews, but tasty all the same.Then nine little tacos to share...we chose the chicken, the mushroom and spinach, and the chorizo.The servers were all nice (not overly...remember you're in London, friends), but yes ...definitely a bit on the slow side.Only downside is that the food sits realllly heavily in your stomach afterwards. We actually both feel a little ill as though we ate three meals in one sitting. It kind of makes me wonder if they deep fat fry The tortilla chips in lard or something. Ugh. Hours later and we are still not feeling great.

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. Nine tacos with soft corn tortillas. Yummy and great guac. 3 kinds here: Chicken tinga, mushrooms and spinach, and chorizo.

VPhHRs9mnjQiZbKvDjOOaw.text: As part of the ongoing Tequila Tuesday quest, El Camion came up as a viable option. Indeed, we say, let's do it!  I even invited some friends along who I know are Mexican lovers, thinking that after the success at previous TT spots, we simply couldn't go wrong.Unfortunately, though out food was good, the entire dining process became so tedious as to be embarrassing. It was nearly impossible to get someone to take our order, and just as difficult to get them to bring the bill, refill our water, or generally check up on us. Given where we were sitting, and the fact that servers could not fail to walk past us at least once every few minutes, I was very disappointed. It was the first place in London where I have not left a service charge.The food was good though, as I say. A bit more Tex-Mex leaning, though we Americans never complain about food that tastes like home. They offered a good variety of margaritas and other cocktails that were tasty and came quickly (once ordered).But, the key is to just not be in any kind of rush.

4uwGzy2sirYsPyAYyNVKvw.text: For Mexican Food in London, this was pretty fantastic. A friend had recommended we try it on vacay, and I was skeptical. Sat at the bar, good margaritas, good food, excellent staff. Recommended for locals or travelers.

5PG4Fmqg6Avo5ghxO75Xdg.text: I went to the downstairs bar of this restaurant called the pink chihuahua which specializes in cocktails that contain tequila. I drank quite a few margaritas which were amazing and had a few shots of straight tequila (possibly not the greatest idea lol). The music was excellent it played disco and soul and towards the end of the night some old school hip hop. I would recommend this place for a cheeky midweek drink.

o9FZAUddw6-r-K_-uAkQ_A.text: First off, don't confuse this with El Camino. They are a world apart (although fairly close geographically) and depending on the organiser's ability to text accurately you may find yourself in a dingy bar instead of the bright lights of El Camion. My visit to EC was prompted by London Cocktail week as they were offering £4 tequila cocktails and £4 taco plates. A meal and a drink for less than a tenner in the middle of Soho? Sorted. Alas, it was not meant to be.I got there and met my friends which raised our first issue. We have booked a table for 4 and were crammed onto a table for two. Luckily we managed to annex a couple of tables as people left (or perhaps were pushed out by our growing group) and got all 8 of us (quite literally 4 friends wandered by on accident and joined in) seated somewhat comfortably if very cosily. Then we tried to order.I will say the waiter dude was very friendly but he highlighted one key issue. The London Cocktail week deal was only available at the bar downstairs. No worries, I like a good basement bar as much as the next alchie but as I got up to move down, I was informed that there was a tequila tasting going on which was running a couple hours late. As a side note, I've got to wonder what exactly was going on down there that made a tequila tasting overrun by that long. To be honest, I'm quite jealous but that's beside the point. We had a bit of a dilemma as we had to be downstairs to get the deal, but we weren't allowed downstairs. Our reasonable suggestion of providing the deal upstairs was met with a firm "no" and little explanation which didn't start us off well.However, as we were entrenched we switched tracks and ordered from the main menu. I selected a pork burrito (in my quest to best Eamon B for London burrito knowledge...however I'm still just a grasshopper compared to him) accompanied by a top shelf margarita. So let's see how they did...The burrito was good. Pork was tender with good flavour, the sour cream and salsa well layered, and the rice nicely done. Overall, it was perfectly fine to kill those hunger pangs in my belly. But not completely. Luckily, when dining with those of the fairer sex I find that there is always more food to be had if you are willing to scavenge. Even better, I have no shame when it comes to devouring leftovers so I promptly finished off the remaining third of a burrito left uneaten by Becky H and even polished off the veggies (it's not meat but it'll do in a pinch) from Claire F. What I really wanted was a plate of tacos for £4 but c'est la vie. Sated, I moved on to my margarita that was left untouched in my food frenzy. Overall, I'll say that the margarita was well made (not as good as Max B's but then again few things are) with a  great balance of tart citrus flavours and mellow tequila. Minor problem. It was served in a tall glass. I'm old fashioned, I like my margaritas in a margarita glass rimmed with salt not looking like a cocktail with a straw!Overall, I think the good balanced out the bad. So I'll give it the average 3-star rating. Although I'm tempted to knock it down a peg as they charge you for chips and salsa and are stingy with portions. I mean seriously, a Mexican place that charges for chips? So wrong.

YLisVNPxFev9QY8p9sZSDQ.text: As someone originally from Texas, perhaps it's harder to find higher ratings in Mexican. The food is tasty, even if a bit a ways away from genuine Tex-Mex. We were there with a bit of a big group (8 people). The place was pretty busy so the waitresses had a bit of a handful. Even so, the waitresses didn't seem like they had a lot of experience. Lots of missed/mistaken orders. The chips and salsa aren't worth it. It's a tiny portion. Barely enough for one person to try. Prices are really reasonable. But there are some catches for that price.

m6rlpN8Hrl0YPzyI1r1w5Q.text: Just had drinks and chips/dip in the bar here Saturday night. OK drinks and very good service - everyone was really nice and attentive even though we just were there for a few margaritas. Would be intrigued to go back and taste the food - nothing I saw looked 'wow' but you never know.

lvhD4K799_hozICBq3NOqQ.text: Seriously, London?Once upon a time, a friend of mine told me a story about when he and his now wife were visiting her family in London.  Apparently she wanted Mexican, and he was dubious as London is not close to Mexico.  He also grew up in California, land of Mexican.  They had Mexican somewhere (I still don't know where), and apparently the food was appalling, which led him to warn me, "There's no good Mexican in London."  Which to be fair, had seemed to be true for awhile.Last night, after drinking copious amounts of beer, a bunch of us were going to dinner, and of course many of them wanted a curry, as good British people do.  My partner and I are always down for going for Mexican instead.  Because hey, once I found a good Mexican, I want to return.  We managed to convince people, but instead of our usual Mexican hang out (because yes, we already found an amazing one), a friend recommend El Camion.  Well, except he couldn't remember the name, so I had to find it online.  I was a bit dubious about a new Mexican, due to the mantra my friend drilled into me before I moved.  Well, I think he just had something terrible, because El Camion turned out to be a flavorful Mexican wonderland!  It was definitely more like the Taqueria style Mexican of California than a more upscale, interesting Mexican fusion that I also enjoy.  The tacos were terrific.  The enchiladas looked great.  I had a bite of someone's burrito which was fantastic.  I ordered the side of spicy potatoes, and they were the perfect amount of spicy.  Their black beans are also fabulous.I'm definitely coming back here.  The only problems is that now I have to choose between two delicious Mexican restaurants.  And next time, I'm getting the flautas and the enchiladas!

xW-oTUPbD_Pjecf_xpLRfA.text: El Camino is a great place to drink, and a pretty mediocre place to eat. Rob, Andrew - maybe you caught it on a good night, but I was taken aback by the miniscule size of the guacamole portion - susanacri; if you had half your portion, then a teaspoonful would be what you'd have eaten it with. In total, we waited an hour for food - half for the starters, half for the main. This was probably because the manager was entertaining his mates that night, and pitchers ('no, sorry, they're for the boss only') were being rushed to his table while customers waited to eat. And waited. In spite of this, we managed to wear the staff down so much with our nagging that we were given two free margaritas each - so our £75 bill for poppers, chips, two enchilladas and four superb margaritas was, supplemented by four more of the same, not such bad value. However, if I'd have had to pay for them, I'd have been livid. The food, as pointed out on Urbanspoon, is d.o.d.g.y. I commented to the waiter that had it come in a box that said 'remove wrapping, pierce film and microwave for two minutes' I'd have been relieved that nobody had wasted ten minutes of their life wrapping it. Think LIDL. Have a margarita here, then head up to Benito's hat on Goodge Street for some great Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. Wake up and...

2_35MOlFE-xit73KFogQgQ.text: Was starving so came here accidentally. Had the portobello mushroom burrito. Was nice was service was a bit slow, although that could be because I an used to the fast factory line of Chipotle!

uWU9vnMQlcVrGM7TbUoFcw.text: Note: this review is for the basement bar and not the restaurant.While out on the town one Saturday night, my friends and I stumbled upon the basement bar in el camino. This is one of those places you have to know about to find as there doesn't seem to be any signage nor would the staff upstairs tell you there is a loungey DJ bar in the basement. The result was a decently crowded place in the heart of soho that still had a free booth or 2! It may or may not be one of those members only places, but just keep walking down the stairs like you belong and you should be grand:) The International crowd was definitely partying it up.Excellent excellent margaritas. Strong and well mixed. I'd go here again for sure for late night drinks!

3rtxxMI1XkrengVXhFao-Q.text: Went on a Tuesday night and it was quite busy. It's a smallish place so we were lucky to get a table. It's quite a casual place, feels a bit like a diner or canteen. Peered into the downstairs bar (which you are allowed into for free if you eat at the restaurant, not sure what the deal is if you just want to go to the bar) and it seemed nice. I had a mushroom burrito and although the guacamole and rice were delicious the beans and mushrooms left a little to be desired. So a mixed bag. Minimal options for vegetarians and vegans, but it is possible to eat there.

lskYatw7yGfno2LMX00qeQ.text: My friends told me that this place used to have really rubbish service, but that they would put up with it for the yummy mexican food(!) However it must have improved because when I visited, the waitresses were friendly, speedy and got everything right. So basically everything is good.I loved the nachos - next time I might just order more nachos for my main.I tried the fish tacos too - they came with a large lump of salad and were really good. Plus the wall of hot sauce is amaaazing!

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. churroooos
Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. fish tacos
Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. wall of hot sauce

BVZQOktQodDpqZ5Y2_3C-Q.text: Able to reserve a table for dinner day of. Portions (tostadas) are pretty small for the price. Food was average but the chipotle salsa had a nice spice. Drinks were not mixed well. The place is open late and would be a good place for a late night snack.

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom

cx7_KBAtcVqSMNfUAw2mRg.text: It was good, nothing out of this world. Just a solid Mexican joint. The mini tacos are a good item to share since they let you try three different kinds of meat. The chicken quesadilla was pretty good too. The meat was well seasoned but it was just a pretty straightforward place. Solid Mexican and open late.

Dt6kgUMIYUbjtkV_SAlWbQ.text: This area gets weirdly dead around midnight unless you want to go to a nightclub full of sweaty drunk people. After eight hours on a shitty plane, all I wanted was booze. The doorman was kind of an asshole (probably because I'm American) but he warmed up after a minute or two and let us in. The margaritas were on point, not watered down and the nachos were tasty.  Prices were right on. The service was BUUUUUUUUUUUULLSHIT. I know service in Europe is less hands on than the US just due to the lack of tipping culture but there's no reason to look directly at an empty glass and then just ignore it. I'm a server and even on my worst day I've never been that terrible at my job. If the service wasn't so bad I would consider this worthy of visiting again. While I don't regret my initial visit I wouldn't rush to return either.

jre0hJMLPr1fx2krPZHIkg.text: Bad service, even for London. Decent nachos and burritos if you're willing to put up with the chore of ordering it from the staff.

sB3WiAzIZQCYyoG4-tft6g.text: London. City of 9 million, give or take. Soho, the amusement epicentre of London, for better or worse - getting a drink after 11pm will be a piece of p... cake, right? Right???Well, wrong!!!I was following one Yelp recommendation after the other, and either they were closed or would not let me in without a reservation (damn you, Cahoots Bar! ;-)  If it wasn't for the lovely bloke Sasha at the also closed Cocktail Trading Co. who sent me off to El Camion I would have gone home without my night cap. Well, four night caps to be precise... The cocktails weren't revolutionary, but solid, the music was house-y / clubby good, the bartenders nice, and a pretty good crowd made this comfortable. I had two Mezcal based cocktails, both pretty good. Not sure whether what was labelled a Hemingway on the bill was meant to be one - while it was pleasant I would not have expected to see Maraschino (liqueur and cherry!) involved with a doble papa... Nevertheless, worth turning in here, if only because they are one of the few decent places open until 3am...

BDqgGP1LOEzl48vCezoUKg.text: I went to the downstairs club here late on a Saturday night and found it a fun and friendly place to sample some delicious margaritas and espresso martinis. The music was great (ideal for a late 20 - early 30 something crowd!) and we had booked a nice booth so we could chat as well as boogie. I definitely recommend it for a small group night out.

epaaPreYWZK2FoMsalam9Q.text: This spot had a good review by Alex whom I trust implicitly, so I was happy to give it a go, being a major fan of Mexicana! I loved the kitschy decor with bottles of chilli sauce lining the walls, and the fun vibe. The menu was pretty comprehensive and the prices reflected the Soho location. We got the large veggie platter with tostadas, tacos, quesadilllas and jaledas (stuffed jalapenos). Everything looked fresh and beautifully prepared. I loved the taste of the food but the chilli sauces on the table tasted flat to me. I would have loved the option of a fresh home-made sauce, which would have elevated this spot to a definite must-return for me. But actually, I probably will come back at some point to try the enchiladas :)

ahLB3KrQWP4cuQG4E8onPQ.text: I know Mexican restaurants are getting kinda popular in London right now, but the fact that this one serves Mezcal definitely sets it apart. I will return here for a drink and meal again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. This chilli-Pina-Rita that I requested to substitute the tequila for a mezcal makes me feel like I'm back at home in California.

ZzhggGV9nV0FIy76GRn7dg.text: Cheap for London. Surprisingly delicious for the price and touristy location. Really efficient service. Hit the spot for great traditional Mexican!

89QfJ-kECwyF3qSIrsFK_w.text: While many of my fellow Yelpers have reviewed this place i'm going to toss my 2 cents in as well.El Camion Mexicano is an interesting little place with an eclectic feel, elaborate hot sauce bottle collection and pretty tasty food. I've been on a it of a search for 'the best of' foods in London. I must say this is pretty good and enjoyable. We had the place all to ourselves due to the time we chose to visit. Our server was nice and attentive. The guacamole was good and the tortillas were warm and crispy as you'd hope for in a Mexican restaurant. I found the chicken tinga quesadillas were yummy and after a comment from Alex S. I knew the cheese stuffed jalapeños were a must. So the spice was nice and it was an all around good experience so we'll be back. This American Southerner in London has found a new 'will visit again' Mexican restaurant y'all. Now give it a go, amigo!

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. Jaladas! Cheese stuffed jalapenos
Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Tinga Tacos
Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Tinga Quesadilla

9HS8UFH2RU-pV7zJdMIfWQ.text: Very delicious Mexican food but you should order starter as the main course is very small . I felt I was in the Mexico city .

photos.caption: Photo of El Camion Mexicano - London, United Kingdom. Tostadas

N8SE9bEkRLahjuiTmC2pSg.text: The cadilac marghs looked great, the nachos were bomb and I couldn't get enough of them and the salsas on the walls as decor are hilarious and make awesome conversation starters. I would gladly go again. The flavours were good. But I just went for snackie cakes and drinks so I'll have to really give them a go another time. I remember the tacos were decent. Mexico street style, which just means small and simple. LIKE ME!!!!! not...

EG50F4OlkJzkYzBvxaJt8g.text: Best Mexican food and Chelada beer. Nothing to argue. Good to be able to go down for a boogie downstairs if you can still move after the food. Great spot to start a night out.

u5V43vRhrUBWpu_F3odg6A.text: Decent Mexican food in heart of Soho - chicken enchiladas melt in your mouth; good guac, seriously good margaritas. Come for the food, stay for the drinks

cPGvS0_Z4zYIm7nPf7t4yQ.text: Really good Mexican food. You get a lot for your money and the ambient was good. Definitely recommend this place.

OdY-SnjZQO2HcoymSBpd2Q.text: I was so excited to go here for my friend's birthday (I love Mexican food, my family is Texan, and I've tried countless places, so I know a good Mexican when I have it!), but was extremely disappointed from the get go.My friend had booked a table for 16 way in advance, and the first thing the hostess said to her was "do you want the tables pushed together?" So the table wasn't ready. So we had to wait for that to be done, and then she was told by the waiter that our group of 16 only had an hour and a half because they had smaller groups coming in later.Throughout ordering (inevitably people were late, it's a large group and a half-decent restaurant should be prepared for that with a large group) we were constantly questioned with things like "are there more people coming?", and at one point the waitress sat next to my boyfriend annoyed because somebody took a little bit too long to order something. Also when she was asked about the tacos (which, notably, were only available in soft shell), was confused as to what we meant when we asked how big they were (£25 for 12 tiny tacos is far overpriced).When our cocktails arrived they were all half-empty and slammed down, and our burritos arrived as dry wraps with rice on the side, which wouldn't be so much of an issue if there was enough rice to go with the wrap, and half of the sauces mentioned in the menu were actually detectable in the flavour. I can't speak for everybody's food, but I can say that of mine and my boyfriend's. But the tacos I saw looked tiny and not worth the money at all.At one point, the waiter (who was actually lovely), told my friend we had to hurry because they needed the table, but could go downstairs, and he agreed to wait until the one person left eating was finished. Less than 30 seconds later, the rude waitress returned and demanded we move in 3 minutes. When my friend said "I can't just tell him to get up and move his food downstairs" she huffed and puffed and made my friend feel uncomfortable.Given this was my friend's 21st birthday, most of us decided to just shift downstairs because she felt so uncomfortable and wanted to get to the next place. However once we got downstairs, after being ID'd and having to put our information in a book because of their "licensing laws", we waited about 10/15 minutes before having the bill slammed on the table by another waitress who rudely snapped "make sure you pay that before you leave".When I looked at the bill, I noted it had a 20% service charge on it!!!! This then upset my friend further, as everybody declared we would not be paying for such horrible service, and her friend went and dealt with the situation while she went and paid almost £10 for a ridiculously small cocktail.From working in hospitality for a great deal of my life, I understand that larger groups bring more revenue, and as a well behaved group with a table of four behind us (they were there when we got there and hadn't moved when we were kicked off our table, for the record) bellowing for our entire meal, I feel extremely offended.All in all a horrible experience, with mediocre food, horrible service, and sub-par cocktails.

bSHovV-2VdaL54pNY1SxXA.text: Used to Mexican food in the USA, this place is really offering a good menu option and the food was really good. The staff was super mega friendly and did go above and beyond to please us. The place has a huge decor of hot sauce, we were told these can be found in the USA, yet if someone is interested to try any, they should ask!

tCsFizaYeatp30lIkQiHGg.text: Finally found a Mexican joint in London that I was pleasantly surprised by!  And thus, El Camion will be my go-to whenever I have a craving.The nachos are out of this world delicious.  And the tortilla chips are much closer to what you get in Texas than what you would get at other places in London.  That being said, paying for chips and salsa?  Erg.  But I'll forgive you, El Camion, for being tasty in every other regard.  We had chicharones with guacamole for starters as well, and those little fried pig skins were perfect.I had the Yucatan Beef burrito as my main, "wet" (read: enchilada sauce), with rice and beans.  While the rice could have used a bit more time cooking, the flavor was good, and the black beans were really tasty.  I wouldn't get the enchilada sauce again as it bordered on sourish, but otherwise, the burrito was fab.But seriously... the nachos.  I'll be back to order a plate of those bad boys all to myself, thank you very much!

cFe7ZY7DVEBF9XL6wjFq2A.text: Can't say I've been to many places where the bouncers, staff AND DJ were simultaneously smashing the whole night into place!It is Soho after all, so the prices can't always be in the favour of our desires.I arrived with some friends for a birthday outing and found the staff to be excruciatingly friendly, laid back and welcoming, all whilst working at such speed that would place Federer's serves at the bottom of the barrel.A great night!
